reviews.review_msg: Long lectures, I feel like I understand the words he says but I don't understand what he is saying. Midterm questions were vague and nothing like study questions. Just horrible
The whole term, I've felt like he is speaking a different language. I beg you. Don't do this to yourself.

NO. He cannot teach I'm sorry not trying to be rude but I sit in a 3 hour lecture not understanding a word he says. One of the worst classes I have taken at SFU by far. If you can, avoid taking 310 with him, trust me I'm trying to help. SFU is trying to sabotage our GPAs by letting him teach this course to undergrad students.

this class is not suited for online teaching. weekly lectures consist of 120 powerpoint slides, 80% of which have an 2-3 minute audio attachment that has no playback speed control. takes forever to take notes, i dont understand why its not been recorded and posted on youtube or zoom.

Ryan is a pretty cool guy who can come off a bit strong. Loves to relate content to his experiences in the field. I mostly enjoyed his course, but 3hr lectures were LONG and lots of information (reflected on exams). Will put you/a group on the spot in class to answer questions. Super helpful in office hours (esp. w/assignments). Reasonable grading.
